verbs.description: disoblige (third-person singular simple present disobliges, present participle disobliging, simple past and past participle disobliged)

entries.meaning: (Britain) to be unwilling to oblige; to disappoint, to inconvenience, not to cooperate.
examples: Sorry to disoblige everybody; I know you were depending on me to bring a good weather forecast for our fête, but it is going to rain.

entries.meaning: (Britain) To offend by an act of unkindness or incivility.
